p: As the climate-health crisis further intensifies in the coming years, the expansion of legal channels for halting and prosecuting climate-destructive, health-threatening operations and anthropogenic activities will prove essential. To ensure that future legal action on environmental issues serves public health objectives, two conditions must be present: 1) public health-framed argumentation must feature strongly in allegations of wrongdoing and 2) courts are receptive to public health arguments and accord their deserved weight in the holistic assessment of cases and determination of legal outcomes.
